title: Campbell's Soup Cans
text: Artwork: Campbell's Soup Cans. Artist: Andy Warhol. Year: 1962. Medium: Synthetic polymer paint on canvas. Description: A famous pop art series consisting of 32 canvases.

title: Marilyn Diptych
text: Artwork: Marilyn Diptych. Artist: Andy Warhol. Year: 1962. Medium: Silkscreen on canvas. Description: A silkscreen painting containing fifty images of Marilyn Monroe.

title: Untitled (Skull)
text: Artwork: Untitled (Skull). Artist: Jean-Michel Basquiat. Year: 1981. Medium: Acrylic and oilstick on canvas. Description: A powerful Neo-expressionist work featuring a skull-like head.

title: Irony of Negro Policeman
text: Artwork: Irony of Negro Policeman. Artist: Jean-Michel Basquiat. Year: 1981. Medium: Acrylic and oilstick on wood. Description: A critical commentary on race and authority.

title: No. 6 (Violet, Green and Red)
text: Artwork: No. 6 (Violet, Green and Red). Artist: Mark Rothko. Year: 1951. Medium: Oil on canvas. Description: An iconic color field painting expressing profound emotion through color.

title: Orange, Red, Yellow
text: Artwork: Orange, Red, Yellow. Artist: Mark Rothko. Year: 1961. Medium: Oil on canvas. Description: A masterpiece of abstraction that sold for a record-breaking price.

title: A Bigger Splash
text: Artwork: A Bigger Splash. Artist: David Hockney. Year: 1967. Medium: Acrylic on canvas. Description: A pop art classic depicting a sun-drenched California swimming pool.

title: Portrait of an Artist (Pool with Two Figures)
text: Artwork: Portrait of an Artist (Pool with Two Figures). Artist: David Hockney. Year: 1972. Medium: Acrylic on canvas. Description: One of the most famous and expensive works by a living artist.
